ARTICLE.TITLE: China asks compatriots for health data before returning from abroad
ARTICLE.TEXT:
China asks compatriots for health data before returning from abroad China asks compatriots for health data before returning from abroad China asks compatriots for health data before returning from abroad

China asks compatriots for health data before returning from abroad

Beijing, April 9 (Prensa Latina) China requires its compatriots who return from 26 countries to send a health information in advance, as part of mechanism to avoid the cross-border Covid-19 pandemic from spreading across the country.

This measure will be applied to those planning to return from Italy, the United States, Germany, Spain, Iran, France, South Korea, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, Austria, Belgium, Sweden, Portugal, Norway, the Netherlands, Australia, Turkey, Malaysia, Denmark, Canada, Israel, Brazil, the Czech Republic, the Philippines, Ireland and Thailand.



Those people must fill out a form on Wechat social network by including their personal data, daily physical conditions and some details about recent travel history, and then present this form to the airline before boarding.



The government proceeded with these measures as official figures showed that 90% of nearly 1,000 Covid-19 patients abroad are fellow countrymen and of these, 40% are students who returned to China.



China is currently applying provisions to punish individuals who lie, such as blacklisting customs, discount points at work.
